page.title: 08HOUSES (FROYLE/HOLYBOURNE)
page.content: Many of the houses in Upper Froyle are old and sometimes modernised, but there are also a few modern houses, connected with Treloar College particularly. A group of houses called{"The {Barracks"}were used for prisoners during the Napoleonic Wars. The{Manor House}and{Vicarage}were {built in Tudor times}or earlier. Many of the houses are named after the {statues of saints}on them, which were brought back from Italy by Sir Hubert Miller over fifty years ago. In Holybourne {a Roman town, Vindomis, disappeared two thousand years ago but gradually since then the present village has grown up around the 'Holy Well' and now new roads of modern houses stand on the old Roman site.
